intro: Stellarioides bakeri, commonly known as Baker's starwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features small, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Stellarioides bakeri thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks.
